full_text:
Re: Order in USA v. Jeffrey Epstein 19 cr 490
From
(b)(6), (b)(7)(C)
To
(b)(6), (b)(7)(C) @nysd.uscourts.gov
Date
2019/08/27 15:06
Subject:
Re: Order in USA v. Jeffrey Epstein 19 cr 490
Attachments:
TEXT.html
Good afternoon (b)(6), (b)(7)(C)
Please thank Judge Berman for the opportunity to attend today. Warden Petrucci sends his regrets for not being able to make it, but he would still appreciate meeting the Judge. Please let me know if Judge Berman would be amenable and has any open time in his schedule.
Thank you,
(b)(6), (b)(7)(C)
Staff Attorney
CLC New York
Metropolitan Correctional Center
150 Park Row
New York, NY 10007
p: 646-836-(b)(6)
f: 646-836-7665
(b)(6), (b)(7)(C) 8/23/2019 10:41 AM >>>
Good morning Christine,
I apologize, but Warden Petrucci told me he won't be able to make it on Tuesday. As you likely know, we've had quite a few visitors here at MCC recently. The Warden just learned about a meeting on Tuesday morning, and he needs to be in attendance. That said, he would welcome the opportunity to meet Judge Berman another time. Perhaps the Warden and I could go over to the courthouse sometime next week at a time convenient for the Judge? Please let me know if that sounds feasible.
Thank you for your help, and I look forward to seeing you on Monday (re: (b)(6), (b)(7)(C)) and Tuesday.
Best,
(b)(6), (b)(7)(C)
Staff Attorney
CLC New York
Metropolitan Correctional Center
150 Park Row
New York, NY 10007
p: 646-836-(b)(6)
Page 4797
DOJ-OGR-00024222

additional_notes: The document is an email chain with redactions on names and phone numbers. The content discusses a meeting between Warden Petrucci and Judge Berman.
